item.description:
Okay, lets go for our regular two mile walk along the Merrimack river for the NINTH week, Wow!

Mild temperatures are planned, with a clear, moon lit, starry sky above us. The feel of winter’s in the air, and ahhh, what a feeling it is!

The holiday season's here and I'm sure many folks maybe a bit edgy with all the; tree trimming, shopping, planning, dealing with traffic, trying to do the "right" thing for those special people in our lives (but somehow screwing it up anyway!), etc, etc. AH! But as it’s said; “it is what it is”. I don’t believe we were meant to know or understand everything that goes on in our lives. That would spawn an emotionless society. All we can do is what we believe is right, and only hope for the best!

So, let’s not be depressed, angry, or disheartened with ourselves, our lives, OR with our friends. We are alive. Alive with our, old and newly found friends alike and life is what we make it. You can either be happy or sad, it's always YOUR choice. Let’s ALL come together this taxing time of year and be thankful for everything we have, no matter how little or how much. It doesn't really matter in the end, now does it?

Let me leave you with a question to ponder.

WHAT IF the world REALLY did come to an end on December 21 2012 @ 11:11 UTC and you knew this was going to be TRUE!

What would you do differently during the remaining 18 days that we have left?

http://www.timeanddate.com/countdown/to?day=21&month=12&year=2012&hour=11&min=11&sec=11&p0=0

What's UTC means? Go here to find out;  http://www.worldtimeserver.com/current_time_in_UTC.aspx

…………….. So, well, that’s my (Canadian) 2 cents, I’ll stop here and just say; “SMILE”, and keep the faith, because we always look so much better when we do!

See you all Monday @ the river.

group.name: The Portsmouth "and beyond" Nite Out Meetup Group

item.name: Let's Walk & Talk Along the River!
